page.title: 11BIOGRAPHY OF M.W. CHARACTER
page.content: William Bradley was born in Market Weighton in l787. He was the tallest Englishman ever recorded. He stood 7 feet 9 inches tall (2.36 metres) , and he weighed 27 stone. His home still stands, but is now the bicycle shop at the end of York Road. The doors of his house had to be specially heightened and special furniture was made to accomodate him. His chair still exists and is kept in the "Bradley Bar" in the Londesborough Arms Hotel. Also remaining is one of his shoes which is exhibited at the Castle Museum, York. He died at the age of 33 and is buried inside All Saints Church, Market Weighton, due to the practice of body snatching in those days. Over his grave is a commemorative plaque.
